types.description: Receives packages defining a strings listing and the actual string selection to then output the selection's contents. It will also output the listing itself formatted to fit in character displays.

in_ports.description: Defines the sequency of items to be selected by the user. Each incoming packet is added to an internal list. Use the CLEAR port to start over. The strings here will fill in the '{value}' field of the format option (e. g. '{title}{value} px'), when sent to STRING output port. Any line breaking characters in the input strings for this port will be translated to a space instead.
in_ports.name: ADD_ITEM

in_ports.description: Change the current selection to the item in question.
in_ports.name: SELECTED

in_ports.description: Clear the selector's internal state, removing all items.
in_ports.name: CLEAR

in_ports.description: Change selection to the next one in the sequence
in_ports.name: NEXT

in_ports.description: Change selection to the previous one in the sequence
in_ports.name: PREVIOUS

in_ports.description: Confirm the selection to be current one, generating output packets on both STRING and SELECTED output ports.
in_ports.name: SELECT

in_ports.description: Make the interaction possible, otherwise don't produce strings or process NEXT/PREVIOUS/SELECT inputs. In other words, enabled/disable the node at run-time. The node starts in the enabled state. Note that this does not affect the use of the ADD_ITEM/CLEAR ports.
in_ports.name: ENABLED

types.name: form/selector

members.description: The number of available columns to lay out the output string with. It must be a positive integer.
members.name: columns

members.description: The number of available rows to lay out the output string with. It must be a positive integer.
members.name: rows

members.description: The title string, to be available for referencing when evaluating the format one by means of the '{title}' tag. Any line breaking characters is this string will be translated to a space instead. If no title is provided, a '{title}' tag in the format will be ignored.
members.name: title

members.description: If set, selected items will be laid out with this string pre-fixed.
members.name: selection_marker

members.description: If set, items under the cursor will be laid out with this string pre-fixed.
members.name: cursor_marker

members.description: The format string to produce the final STRING output with. The syntax is a free-form string with one '{value}' sub-string in it (and one optional '{title}' one). The value tag will be replaced by the actual string items that came in the ITEMS port, while the title one will be replaced by the title string option, if set. The title tag must occur before the value one.
members.name: format

members.description: If true, this makes a circular menu, where after the last option it goes back to the first (and vice-versa).
members.name: circular

out_ports.description: The formatted list of entries output. This is meant to feed real display nodes (like grove/lcd-string).
out_ports.name: STRING
